segment_text: True! — nervous — very, very dreadfully nervous I had been and am; but why will you say that I am mad? The disease had sharpened my senses — not destroyed — not dulled them.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: Above all was the sense of hearing acute. I heard all things in the heaven and in the earth. I heard many things in hell. How, then, am I mad?
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: Hearken! and observe how healthily — how calmly I can tell you the whole story.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: It is impossible to say how first the idea entered my brain; but once conceived, it haunted me day and night. Object there was none. Passion there was none. I loved the old man. He had never wronged me.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: He had never given me insult. For his gold I had no desire. I think it was his eye! yes, it was this!
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: One of his eyes resembled that of a vulture — a pale blue eye, with a film over it. Whenever it fell upon me, my blood ran cold; and so by degrees — very gradually — I made up my mind to take the life of the old man, and thus rid myself of the eye forever.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: Now this is the point. You fancy me mad. Madmen know nothing. But you should have seen me. You should have seen how wisely I proceeded — with what caution — with what foresight — with what dissimulation I went to work!
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I was never kinder to the old man than during the whole week before I killed him. And every night, about midnight, I turned the latch of his door and opened it — oh, so gently!
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: And then, when I had made an opening sufficient for my head, I put in a dark lantern, all closed, closed, so that no light shone out, and then I thrust in my head.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: Oh, you would have laughed to see how cunningly I thrust it in! I moved it slowly — very, very slowly, so that I might not disturb the old man's sleep.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: It took me an hour to place my whole head within the opening so far that I could see him as he lay upon his bed. Ha! — would a madman have been so wise as this?
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: And then, when my head was well in the room, I undid the lantern cautiously — oh, so cautiously — cautiously (for the hinges creaked) — I undid it just so much that a single thin ray fell upon the vulture eye.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: And this I did for seven long nights — every night just at midnight — but I found the eye always closed; and so it was impossible to do the work; for it was not the old man who vexed me, but his Evil Eye.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: And every morning, when the day broke, I went boldly into the chamber, and spoke courageously to him, calling him by name in a hearty tone, and inquiring how he had passed the night.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: So you see he would have been a very profound old man, indeed, to suspect that every night, just at twelve, I looked in upon him while he slept.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: Upon the eighth night I was more than usually cautious in opening the door. A watch's minute hand moves more quickly than did mine. Never before that night had I felt the extent of my own powers — of my sagacity.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I could scarcely contain my feelings of triumph. To think that there I was, opening the door, little by little, and he not even to dream of my secret deeds or thoughts.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I fairly chuckled at the idea; and perhaps he heard me; for he moved on the bed suddenly, as if startled. Now you may think that I drew back — but no.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: His room was as black as pitch with the thick darkness, (for the shutters were close fastened, through fear of robbers,) and so I knew that he could not see the opening of the door, and I kept pushing it on steadily, steadily.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I had my head in, and was about to open the lantern, when my thumb slipped upon the tin fastening, and the old man sprang up in the bed, crying out — 'Who's there?'
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I kept quite still and said nothing. For a whole hour I did not move a muscle, and in the meantime I did not hear him lie down. He was still sitting up in the bed listening; — just as I have done, night after night, hearkening to the death watches in the wall.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: Presently I heard a slight groan, and I knew it was the groan of mortal terror. It was not a groan of pain or of grief — oh, no! — it was the low stifled sound that arises from the bottom of the soul when overcharged with awe.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I knew the sound well. Many a night, just at midnight, when all the world slept, it has welled up from my own bosom, deepening, with its dreadful echo, the terrors that distracted me.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I say I knew it well. I knew what the old man felt, and pitied him, although I chuckled at heart. I knew that he had been lying awake ever since the first slight noise, when he had turned in the bed.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: His fears had been ever since growing upon him. He had been trying to fancy them causeless, but could not. He had been saying to himself — 'It is nothing but the wind in the chimney — it is only a mouse crossing the floor,' or 'it is merely a cricket which has made a single chirp.'
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: Yes, he has been trying to comfort himself with these suppositions: but he had found all in vain. All in vain; because Death, in approaching him had stalked with his black shadow before him, and enveloped the victim.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: And it was the mournful influence of the unperceived shadow that caused him to feel — although he neither saw nor heard — to feel the presence of my head within the room.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: When I had waited a long time, very patiently, without hearing him lie down, I resolved to open a little — a very, very little crevice in the lantern. So I opened it — you cannot imagine how stealthily, stealthily — until, at length a single dim ray, like the thread of the spider, shot from out the crevice and fell upon the vulture eye.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: It was open — wide, wide open — and I grew furious as I gazed upon it. I saw it with perfect distinctness — all a dull blue, with a hideous veil over it that chilled the very marrow in my bones; but I could see nothing else of the old man's face or person: for I had directed the ray as if by instinct, precisely upon the damned spot.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: And now have I not told you that what you mistake for madness is but over acuteness of the senses? — now, I say, there came to my ears a low, dull, quick sound, such as a watch makes when enveloped in cotton. I knew that sound well, too. It was the beating of the old man's heart.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: It increased my fury, as the beating of a drum stimulates the soldier into courage. But even yet I refrained and kept still. I scarcely breathed. I held the lantern motionless. I tried how steadily I could maintain the ray upon the eye.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: Meantime the hellish tattoo of the heart increased. It grew quicker and quicker, and louder and louder every instant. The old man's terror must have been extreme! It grew louder, I say, louder every moment! — do you mark me well?
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I have told you that I am nervous: so I am. And now at the dead hour of the night, amid the dreadful silence of that old house, so strange a noise as this excited me to uncontrollable terror. Yet, for some minutes longer I refrained and stood still.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: But the beating grew louder, louder! I thought the heart must burst. And now a new anxiety seized me — the sound would be heard by a neighbor! The old man's hour had come!
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: With a loud yell, I threw open the lantern and leaped into the room. He shrieked once — once only. In an instant I dragged him to the floor, and pulled the heavy bed over him.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I then smiled gaily, to find the deed so far done. But, for many minutes, the heart beat on with a muffled sound. This, however, did not vex me; it would not be heard through the wall. At length it ceased. The old man was dead.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I removed the bed and examined the corpse. Yes, he was stone, stone dead. I placed my hand upon the heart and held it there many minutes. There was no pulsation. He was stone dead. His eye would trouble me no more.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: If still you think me mad, you will think so no longer when I describe the wise precautions I took for the concealment of the body. The night waned, and I worked hastily, but in silence. First of all I dismembered the corpse. I cut off the head and the arms and the legs.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: I then took up three planks from the flooring of the chamber, and deposited all between the scantlings. I then replaced the boards so cleverly, so cunningly, that no human eye — not even his — could have detected any thing wrong.
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: There was nothing to wash out — no stain of any kind — no blood-spot whatever. I had been too wary for that. A tub had caught all — ha! ha!
scene_description: indoors, dimly lit bedroom, heavy shadows, antique wooden furniture, partially open door, dark lantern

segment_text: When I had made an end of these labors, it was four o'clock — still dark as midnight. As the bell sounded the hour, there came a knocking at the street door. I went down to open it with a light heart, — for what had I now to fear?
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: There entered three men, who introduced themselves, with perfect suavity, as officers of the police. A shriek had been heard by a neighbor during the night; suspicion of foul play had been aroused; information had been lodged at the police office, and they (the officers) had been deputed to search the premises.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: I smiled, — for what had I to fear? I bade the gentlemen welcome. The shriek, I said, was my own in a dream. The old man, I mentioned, was absent in the country. I took my visitors all over the house. I bade them search — search well.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: I led them, at length, to his chamber. I showed them his treasures, secure, undisturbed. In the enthusiasm of my confidence, I brought chairs into the room, and desired them here to rest from their fatigues, while I myself, in the wild audacity of my perfect triumph, placed my own seat upon the very spot beneath which reposed the corpse of the victim.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: The officers were satisfied. My manner had convinced them. I was singularly at ease. They sat, and while I answered cheerily, they chatted of familiar things. But, ere long, I felt myself getting pale and wished them gone.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: My head ached, and I fancied a ringing in my ears: but still they sat and still chatted. The ringing became more distinct: — it continued and became more distinct: I talked more freely to get rid of the feeling: but it continued and gained definitiveness — until, at length, I found that the noise was not within my ears.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: No doubt I now grew very pale; — but I talked more fluently, and with a heightened voice. Yet the sound increased — and what could I do? It was a low, dull, quick sound — much such a sound as a watch makes when enveloped in cotton.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: I gasped for breath — and yet the officers heard it not. I talked more quickly — more vehemently; but the noise steadily increased. I arose and argued about trifles, in a high key and with violent gesticulations; but the noise steadily increased.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: Why would they not be gone? I paced the floor to and fro with heavy strides, as if excited to fury by the observations of the men — but the noise steadily increased. Oh God! what could I do? I foamed — I raved — I swore!
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: I swung the chair upon which I had been sitting, and grated it upon the boards, but the noise arose over all and continually increased. It grew louder — louder — louder! And still the men chatted pleasantly, and smiled. Was it possible they heard not? Almighty God! — no, no! They heard! — they suspected! — they knew! — they were making a mockery of my horror!
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: — this I thought, and this I think. But anything was better than this agony! Anything was more tolerable than this derision! I could bear those hypocritical smiles no longer! I felt that I must scream or die! — and now — again! — hark! louder! louder! louder! louder! —
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture

segment_text: 'Villains!' I shrieked, 'dissemble no more! I admit the deed! — tear up the planks! — here, here! — it is the beating of his hideous heart!'
scene_description: indoors, bedroom with wooden floorboards, morning light filtering through closed shutters, disturbed bed, antique furniture
